message: I bought a beautiful HUUUUUGE butternut over the weekend and am thinking to slice it in half and do it as a stuffed butternut (main meal) for supper. Any suggestions? So far all i have in mind is couscous, and perhaps drizzle cheesey sauce over?

@RobynSA I always turn my butternut squash into my sweet & spicy butternut soup (I prefer acorn squash for stuffing) -- but I think quinoa or couscous, cranberries, pecans (optional), green onions -- that would be a good filler.

I would think a spicy black bean and brown rice stuffing would be good, too. Maybe cook the rice with some lime juice, and do the beans with onions, bell and jalapenos. Then combine them. (I stuff poblano peppers with this)
thanks for the suggestions! i'm going to combine both and do a quinoa or cous cous black bean jobbbie. my mouth is watering at the thought!
